result.execSummary:
The defendant Noe Alvarez Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Probation to be transferred to Milwaukee County

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA surcharge
*Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge 
*Costs/Surcharges to be paid from bond monies and remaining balance to be returned to poster
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

*No abusive contact with Ms Herrera 
*Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.

Disbursements Journal Final
request for refund

Defendant Noe Alvarez Jr. in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:58 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - No contest
Count 4 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 and Count 3 & Count 2 and Count 4 are DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court.
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 30 day jail sentence 
Placed on Probation for 12 months -
**Conditions of Probation:
Probation to be transferred to Milwaukee County
Pay costs/surcharges to be paid from bond and remaining balance returned to poster
Pay DNA surcharge
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
No abusive contact with Ms Herrera.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.

Count 2 - DRI

Count 3 -
Impose/Stay 90 day jail sentence - consecutive to Count 1 
Placed on Probation for 12 months -
**Conditions of Probation:
Probation to be transferred to Milwaukee County
16 days jail
16 days credit
Time served sentence 
Pay costs/surcharges to be paid from bond and remaining balance returned to poster
Pay DNA surcharge 
Comply with conditions in Count 1

Count 4 - DRI

20 days to appeal
/s/ RJS
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 4, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
